thread.title: Stanford women shoot lights out at Maples Pavilion
thread.title_full: Stanford women shoot lights out at Maples Pavilion

author:
Elliott Almond

ealmond@mercurynews.com
title: Stanford women shoot lights out at Maples Pavilion
text:
Stanford women shoot lights out at Maples Pavilion By Elliott Almond Posted: 10/14/2015 03:19:20 PM PDT Updated: 10/14/2015 03:19:21 PM PDT SAN FRANCISCO -- Stanford forward Erica McCall hit the floor this week when an alarm echoed inside Maples Pavilion. 
"It was just instinct," McCall said Wednesday at Pac-12 women's basketball media day. "When I hear a loud pop" she drops. 
But McCall and teammates eventually kept practicing Monday afternoon even as lights went out and a small fire started on the arena's roof. 
"Now I can say we were shooting lights out," coach Tara VanDerveer said. 
The Cardinal stayed in the gym for more than a half hour working on jump shots, free throws and doing sprinting drills until authorities ordered them to evacuate the building. 
They sprinted out of Maples and waited for 90 minutes before VanDerveer cancelled the practice. 
The power outage that affected 35 buildings was triggered because of deconstruction work at the school's energy plant. The Maples fire started about 15 minutes after the outage when emergency lights ignited roofing material. 
No one was injured. 
In 1989, the Loma Prieta earthquake interrupted a Cardinal weight room session. 
"And we won the national championship" that season, VanDerveer said. Advertisement
